cs.CR, cs.IOT, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.Distributed. 

The paper discusses the design and development of a smart contract-based solution for secure interaction with smart devices in the IoT paradigm. This involves access control, authentication, and payments in a decentralized setting, which are all relevant topics in the field of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also specifically focuses on the IoT paradigm, which is a subfield of computer networks (cs.IOT). Additionally, the paper discusses the limitations and constraints imposed by both blockchain technologies and the IoT paradigm, which are relevant topics in distributed computing (cs.DC) and software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper proposes a solution that involves the use of smart contracts, which is a technology commonly associated with blockchain and distributed systems (cs.Distributed).
